physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General physical, mental-status, and cranial-nerve examinations were normal. Muscle bulk was normal. Dystonic posturing of the left foot in plantar flexion with inversion. Dystonic posturing of the left hand in palmar flexion with fingers flexed and extended at the joints. Milder dystonic posturing in the right foot and hand. Intermittent twisting of the head to the right. No weakness or sensory abnormality. Deep-tendon reflexes were ++ and symmetric. Plantar responses were flexor. Gait was slow, effortful, and clumsy.
Marked improvement in symptoms within 24 hours of starting therapy with carbidopa and levodopa.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, symptoms included painful spasms and difficulty walking. After initiation of treatment, she experienced significant improvement in mobility and reduction of dystonia.
